SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
SPR effect has been used in a number of applications such as biosensors and food safety sensors [1-2]. In the Otto configuration based SPR chip, a negative effect of the adhesion layer on the SPR quality can be eliminated because of the arrangement of the metal film which is separated from the glass substrate and this characteristic was analyzed a previous study [3]. It is widely known that the air-gap distance of the SPR chip is a very important factor for attaining high sensitivity. In an accurately designed SPR chip, the resonance angle of the SPR curve is shifted perceptively when the target molecule is detected. Thus, if the SPR chip has multiple air-gap distances, multiple SPR effects can be used to detect various target molecules by using a single SPR chip.
In this study, an Otto configuration based SPR chip with multiple air-gaps for real-time multiple SPR sensing is proposed and fabricated using the silicon on quartz (SoQ) bonding process. The multiple SPR effect of the proposed SPR chip is analyzed by using FEM simulation.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
In this study, Otto configuration based SPR chip with multiple air-gaps is designed. SPR characteristics of the proposed SPR chip are analyzed using FEM simulation. The proposed SPR chip has four sections which have separate air-gaps of 0.9 𝛍m, 1.2 𝛍m, 1.5 𝛍m and 1.8 𝛍m, sequentially. Each section of the SPR chip has different SPR characteristics according to the air-gap thickness. Optimized SPR effect is occurred when a laser beam which has a wavelength of 785 nm and 977 nm is reflected at the section 2 and section 3, respectively.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:
Neste trabalho, propomos o uso do controle de temperatura de lasers DFB em conjunto com grades de difração no infravermelho próximo para observação do espectro RPS,
em um ângulo fixo. A abordagem também permite o uso de técnicas tradicionais de análise espectral do efeito RPS, como a espectroscopia de modulação de comprimento de onda. Estudos de caso são simulados para demonstrar a viabilidade da abordagem,
com base nas curvas de resposta térmica de lasers DFB comercialmente disponíveis.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
Como parte de um projeto de fabricação de sensores otimizados baseados na excitação de ressonância de plásmons de superfície (RPS) sob incidência normal, este trabalho apresenta resultados computacionais e experimentais obtidos em grade de
difração metalizada com alumínio. Nos resultados experimentais, é possível identificar claramente o efeito de RPS e sua eliminação, quando a polarizaçµao do feixe de luz incidente é desviada em relação àquela prevista para ocorrência do efeito. Esses resultados corroboram com a viabilidade da proposta de observação de
RPS sob incidência normal e a eficácia do modelo de simulação proposto.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This article describes the development of a dedicated microcontrolled digital lock-in amplifier based on an STM32 microcontroller chip. The prototype was used in experiments of wavelength modulation spectroscopy, directed to the detection of acetylene in a multiple-pass spectrometric cell having 78 cm of optical path length. Paired experiments were done with a commercial DSP7265 lock-in amplifier. A strong correlation between measurements was observed in general for varying concentration of acetylene, with a minimum correlation of 95% observed for the lowest acetylene concentration detected at 13 ppm.

A strong correlation between measurements was observed in general for varying concentration of acetylene, with a minimum correlation of 95% observed for the lowest acetylene concentration detected at 13 ppm.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This paper describes the design, parameter optimization and simulation of a resonant device using the CST
Studio Suite for the development of a sensor capable of detecting hydrogen at microwave frequencies. The device is reconfigurable as it comprises a U-shaped resonator that can slide relative to a static stripline. As a result of this strategy, it is possible to investigate a configuration that yields the best response for hydrogen detection, taking into account the frequency variation and insertion loss induced by hydrogen gas on the palladium present in the device.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this work, the particle swarm optimization algorithm is used to determine the optimum parameters for maximum sensitivity of the surface plasmon resonance effect at normal inicidence on a rectangular metal grating. To avoid convergence problems, a continuous function is used to represent the grating profile. For the optimization problem, the Rayleigh?s hypothesis is used to model the diffracted fields across a metal-vacuum interface. The calculated responses, obtained by use of either the more rigorous Chandezon method or COMSOL?s finite element based approach, confirm the validity of the optimization approach.

The calculated responses, obtained by use of either the more rigorous Chandezon method or COMSOL?s finite element based approach, confirm the validity of the optimization approach.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper describes a preliminary study of the pollution deposition on high voltage glass- and porcelain-type insulator strings of high voltage transmission lines located in four states of the northeast region of Brazil. Six leakage current monitoring systems, comprising leakage, humidity and temperature sensors, a processing electronic module and a satellite communication link were installed on 230 and 500 kV towers. The information is downloaded from the satellite link provider website and is inserted in a database with a web-based graphical user interface. Preliminary field results are presented and analyzed here. The state of the pollution deposition can be indirectly inferred from the analysis of the number of pulses of the leakage current signal together with the humidity. For a better characterization of the environment, temperature measurement is also implemented.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de Equipamentos de Instrumentação Médico-Hospitalares, Instrumentos de Precisão e Ópticos, Equipamentos Para Automação Industrial, Cronômetros e Relógios

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
CORRESPONDING AUTHOR: EDUARDO FONTANA
Abstract:
The surface plasmon spectroscopy (SPS) technique is used in the characterization of dielectric-coated metal mirrors. Experiments performed on a MgF2-coated aluminum mirror indicate good agreement between SPS and ellipsometry techniques for the determination of coating thickness. In addition, the optical constants of aluminum obtained from the same experiment agree well with values presented in the literature. Advantages of SPS are that it is a simple procedure providing a high degree of accuracy, and only a single measurement is required to yield both the film thickness and the complex permittivity of the substrate.

Surface plasmon immunoassay

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Prop. Óticas e Espectrosc. da Mat. Condens; Outras Inter. da Mat. com Rad. e Part.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
CORRESPONDING AUTHOR: EDUARDO FONTANA
Abstract:
The most sensitive existing assays used to determine antibody levels in blood serum samples require a tracer material, e.g., radioisotope, fluorofore, or enzyme, to identify the specific analyte. Surface plasmon spectroscopy has been applied recently as a no-label technique for the assay of specific antibody solutions with the antigen proteins immobilized on a metal surface. It is found that the metal surface configuration originally proposed for the surface plasmon immunoassay (SPI) is unstable and unsuitable for the assay of specific antibodies in a large mixture of proteins such as in a blood serum. Nevertheless, by properly designing the metal surface structure, the SPI can be made an extremely practical device. Preliminary results for the assay of dinitrophenyl (DNP) and keyhole limpet hemocyanin (KLH) antibodies in blood serum samples, indicate that the SPI, in addition to providing a simple and fast measurement, is comparable with existing approaches, such as radioimmunoassy or enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay both in sensitivity and specificity.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Real Time Monitoring of the Leakage Current of 230 kV Glass-Type Insulators During Washing

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Fernando José do Monte de Melo Cavalcanti

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Transmissão da Energia Elétrica, Distribuição da Energia Elétrica

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de Equipamentos de Instrumentação Médico-Hospitalares, Instrumentos de Precisão e Ópticos, Equipamentos Para Automação Industrial, Cronômetros e Relógios

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
This paper reports the real time behavior of the leakage current flowing on glass-type insulator strings of a 230 kV substation tower during washing. Monitoring of two insulator strings in the tower is achieved by use of a pair of optical fiber sensors that detect samples of the leakage current waveforms and transmit those samples to a processing module via an optical link. It is observed that leakage current during washing may reach high peak levels, and the effectiveness of the washing can be inferred by the degree of leakage current after drying of the insulator strings. Direct monitoring of the leakage current can thus be used as an important guideline for proper washing procedures during this type of intervention as well as for determining the effectiveness of the procedure.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de Equipamentos de Instrumentação Médico-Hospitalares, Instrumentos de Precisão e Ópticos, Equipamentos Para Automação Industrial, Cronômetros e Relógios

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Leakage current detection is a promising method for measuring pollution levels on insulators of overhead transmission lines. This paper describes the development of a leakage current sensor based on a fiber-coupled light-emitting diode, as well as the development of a processing module that detects, stores, and classifies leakage current peaks that are directly related to partial discharges on the surface of the high-voltage insulators. The relative humidity is also detected and stored for further analysis. The processing module uses a PIC 16F877A microcontroller and can register the rate of partial discharges for two months on three different levels.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Leakage current detection is a promising method for measuring pollution levels on insulators of overhead transmission lines. This paper describes the development of a leakage current sensor based on a fiber-coupled light-emitting diode, as well as the development of a processing module that detects, stores, and classifies leakage current peaks that are directly related to partial discharges on the surface of the high-voltage insulators. The relative humidity is also detected and stored for further analysis. The processing module uses a PIC 16F877A microcontroller and can register the rate of partial discharges for two months on three different levels.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Leakage Current Activity on Glass-Type Insulators of Overhead Transmission Lines in the Northeast Region of Brazil

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Fernando José do Monte de Melo Cavalcanti

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Medição, Controle, Correção e Proteção de Sistemas Elétricos de Potência

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Fabricação de Equipamentos de Instrumentação Médico-Hospitalares, Instrumentos de Precisão e Ópticos, Equipamentos Para Automação Industrial, Cronômetros e Relógios

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
This paper describes a study of the leakage current activity on glass-type insulators of high-voltage transmission lines over a three-month period. Three pairs of sensor systems were installed, one on a 500-kV field tower and the other two on 230-kV and 500-kV substation towers, all in the northeast region of Brazil. The locations were chosen due to their particular environment characteristics and the previous knowledge of pollution severity in these locations. The correlation of the leakage current attributes with in situ humidity records, insulator positions on the tower, and seasonality are discussed.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:
Neste artigo são descritos alguns dos desenvolvimentos realizados nos últimos anos na área de Sensores do Grupo de Fotônica do DES-UFPE. Sistemas completos para aplicações científicas e industriais têm sido elaborados com base em uma metodologia que abrange desde o projeto da cabeça sensora e do circuito de processamento eletrônico dos sinais ? passando pelo dimensionamento e implantação do sistema de comunicação mais adequado para a transmissão desses sinais ? até o desenvolvimento do aplicativo de aquisição e gerenciamento dos dados para o usuário final. Algumas aplicações são brevemente discutidas, e três sistemas, um com potencial de aplicação no setor de petróleo e gás e dois outros desenvolvidos para o setor elétrico são descritos de forma mais detalhada.
Link para a revista:
http://iecom.dee.ufcg.edu.br/~reviecom/

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Sensor Network for Monitoring the State of Pollution of High-Voltage Insulators Via Satellite

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Fernando José do Monte de Melo Cavalcanti

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
This paper describes the design and development of a sensor system network for remote monitoring of the state of pollution on high-voltage insulators, its deployment amongst four states in the northeast region of Brazil and preliminary analysis of the data gathered by the system. Six monitoring units, each composed by leakage current, humidity and temperature sensors, an electronic processing module and a satellite communication link, were built and installed on 230 and 500 kV transmission towers. Measured data are sent by the different systems via satellite to a database controlled by a web-based graphical user interface, incorporated into the supervision management system of the electric utility company. Example field results on one of the sensor systems, both for short and long term measurements, show a direct correlation of the activity recorded by the system with the pollution level expected to occur nearby the corresponding monitoring point.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
In internal reflection metrology using prisms, the prism is usually mounted on a rotation/translation stage to enable adjusting angle and location of the laser footprint on the surface. If a visual inspection method is used to find the laser footprint, the task becomes impossible if invisible radiation in the near infrared is employed. In addition, it may desirable to perform angular scan experiments with a stationary footprint on the surface during scan, or even to automatically probe specific points on an extended prism face for predetermined incidence angles. In this paper a formulation is developed to determine the required translation along the prism face to allow maintaining the laser footprint stationary under a given rotation. A web based app developed under the scope of this work, allows demonstrating the applicability of the approach for silica, BK7 and SF2 glasses, in the wavelength range from 500 to 1500 nm, and for an arbitrary geometry of the glass prism.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Machine Learning Methods Applied on Long Term Data Analysis for Rain Detection in a Partial Discharge Sensor Network

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: International Journal On Advances in Intelligent Systems

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Partial discharges (PD) on the surface of high voltage insulators are directly related with the accumulation of pollution. A complete partial discharge sensor network was previously developed and has been in operation for approximately three years. This system records the PD activity, classifying it into four levels. As the PD activity is influenced by the weather conditions, each sensor system in the network also measures the one-hour average temperature and relative humidity. Also a fuzzy inference system was developed to extract the flashover occurrence risk level based on the partial discharge activity recorded. However, a strong rain event can wash insulators almost instantaneously, in turn decreasing the risk level. For a correct interpretation of the results it is important to properly analyze the weather data to detect the rain occurrence. This paper presents a comparison among three machine learning techniques for rain detection from humidity and temperature data, namely, Naïve Bayes Classifier, Support Vector Machines and Multilayer Perceptron Neural Network. These are trained on data gathered by meteorological stations located nearby the PD sensors and used in conjunction with the data obtained by the Sensor Network. Studies on the generalization training power and long term data analysis on sensor data are performed and presented.

In the process of building a real time, optical sensor system, for remote monitoring of the operational state of high-voltage transformers, the response time of the sensor head has to be predicted. This response time depends on the rate of transport of molecules through a liquid-gas interface in the sensor head. In this work, a simple model is used to analyze and evaluate the permeation properties of the interface. Based on experimental results for the quantification of acetylene ?? one of the key indicator molecules in the insulating oil ?? by wavelength modulation spectroscopy in the near infrared, the response time is obtained from the system as well as the correlation between concentrations in the gas and in the liquid phases. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Publicado online em 21 de Dezembro 2016 
Abstract: This paper describes development of a control and acquisition module?CAM?capable of driving multiple DFB lasers and performing data acquisition of harmonic detection signals of gas spectral lines for applications in the electric power industry. The system comprises a novel approach to set the operating parameters of several distributed feedback?DFB?lasers, by means of a single OEM driver with solid-state relays and auxiliary circuits. A preliminary performance analysis is reported with respect to laser polarization/modulation and temperature control, harmonic distortion, as well as optical power output and emission wavelength, for the case of two DFB lasers. Paired experiments directed to the harmonic detection of carbon monoxide further demonstrate the dependability of the module.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Disponível online desde 10/05/2016
Abstract:
In this paper, an Otto coupling configuration based SPR chip is designed, simulated and fabricated using a silicon-on-quartz (SoQ) bonding process. The simulation of the SPR effect is conducted using COMSOL Multiphysics simulator (Altsoft Co.) using the designed chip dimensions, the optical constants are interpolated from data available in the literature. The size of the fabricated SPR chip is 30×30×1mm3. Resonance angle and reflectance are measured to be 42.19° and 0.411°, respectively, using an automated reflectometer. Discrepancy between measurement and simulation results is discussed by optical constant of the gold layer used as a thin metal film. The SoQ bonding process is a feasible approach for implementation of Otto coupling configuration based SPR chips.

J.-M. Kim and E. Fontana contributed equally.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
This paper presents experimental results, approximate
analytical formulations, and numerical simulation results to
analyze the reflectance from a metalized fiber tip under corrosion,
which is part of a corrosion sensor. Moreover, the dynamics of
corrosion on a thin metallic film is modeled computationally by
considering a proposed roughness fitting function to consider the
evolution of film thickness and shape during the corrosion process.
For this modeling, COMSOL Multiphysics is used to simulate the
optical signal reflected from the transducer element of the sensor.
The simulation results for the optical signal reflected from a
rough metallic film are compared with experimental and analytical
results. The results reveal that the corrosion process generates
an inhomogeneous metallic structure that allows the occurrence
of surface plasmon resonance, and the proposed simple surface
roughness model can be used to describe the dynamic process of
corrosion of an aluminum film that is deposited on the end-facet of
an optical fiber.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
In the process of developing a simple and highly sensitive dissolved gas analysis (DGA) sensor system, applicable for surveillance of the operating conditions of high-voltage equipment, a systematic optimization strategy has been conducted to allow detecting low concentration levels of DGA target molecules, by use of the harmonic detection technique, without use of long interaction length, multipass cells. Gas phase experiments were carried out by use of carbon monoxide ? one of the target molecules in DGA? as a model to evaluate the limitations in detection sensitivity imposed by electronic noise, etalon effects, optical interference noise and mode hopping in the system?s optical assembly. By properly setting up the electronic detection system and designing the optical circuit and measurement cell, it was possible to detect a minimum carbon monoxide concentration of 90 ppm with a single pass, 25.4 cm cell, around the 1568 nm absorption line of the gas. This detection sensitivity, together with the simplicity of the measurement principle, allows establishing the proposed configuration as a feasible alternative for practical use in real-time, DGA of insulating oils of high-voltage transformers.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
ARTIGO DE 11 PÁGINAS
Abstract:
In this paper, a phenomenological model is presented for the molecular transport across multiple inter-faces, involving liquid/gas boundaries or gas/gas phases separated by a thin membrane. A simple rate equation model is proposed on the assumption that diffusion effects in the different phases can be neglected. The model is applied for the characterization of the desorption of acetylene molecules from transformer oil, by wavelength modulation spectroscopy. A semi-quantitative analysis shows that the model yields a good prediction of the time evolution of the desorption process, either for a single or for a double interface conﬁguration. The study originally directed to applications in dissolved gas analysis for surveillance in substations, has broader applicability in the characterization of sorption and desorption processes of other liquid/gas systems.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
Recently a surface plasmon resonance (SPR) optical sensor, based on the Otto configuration --the Otto chip -- has been developed. One essential step in the quality control of the fabrication process is characterization of the active region of several devices in a batch. Characterization is done by measuring the angular spectrum of the optical reflectance on several points across the active region of the device, and determining parameters by regression analysis of the data. Traditional gradient methods used in the regression process are extremely dependent on an initial guess and are not very efficient for batch analysis of curves, when those include poorly defined SPR spectra, where an initial guess may be hard to infer. An alternative approach for the regression problem is to model the analysis as an optimization problem and using an efficient stochastic algorithm. In this paper one discusses the use of Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) for characterization of Otto chip devices. From comparative studies carried out in an existing Otto chip, it is observed that PSO can be a very efficient approach for batch analysis and yields better results when compared with the traditional gradient-based regression method.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
This work examines the prospects of a low-cost retroreflection optical sensor system for detection of the interface between two immiscible liquids, for applications in oil separation tanks. The sensor in its simplest configuration comprises a bare fiber optic tip, cleaved at an angle of 90◦ relative to the longitudinal fiber axis. The device tested experimentally is based on a 2x2 bidirectional coupler, which connects the sensor tip to a laser and two photodetectors, one used to measure the signal and the other as a reference. From experiments conducted in a laboratory water-oil system, the measured retro-reflected signal was very small, and of the same order as the differential signal due to low optical contrast liquids. To overcome this difficulty, the detection system was designed with an amplification stage, followed by filtering of the digitally converted signal. With this strategy, an accuracy of 99.7% was reached. On the light of the performance measured by the bare fiber tip configuration, an analysis on the potential improvement in performance obtained, by applying a thin layer of gold to the tip of the sensor, was made. Results indicated that, for an optimized gold film, 13 nm thick, a 13-fold improvement in the sensor detection limit was obtained.
Corresponding author: Eduardo Fontana

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Influence of surface roughness on the sensitivity of a D-shaped optical fiber-based refractive index sensor

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents the evaluation of the influence of surface roughness on the performance of a refractive index sensor based on a D-shaped optical fiber. In addition, the manufacturing process of D-shaped sections on standard silica single-mode optical fibers with different rms roughness values is described. The surface roughness morphology generated by the abrasive process is measured by processing microscopic images using the Gwyddion software. A model for the surface roughness, using the third order Weierstrass fractal function, is proposed and simulated with COMSOL Multiphysics. Experimental and simulation results are presented. The results show that the surface roughness increases the device insertion loss, as expected, but contributes positively to the sensitivity of the refractive index sensor, reaching sensitivity levels of 148.87 dB/RIU with a resolution of 10−4 RIU. The good agreement between the computational and experimental results is highlighted. Due to the good figures of merit obtained, the optical sensor has potential of application in biochemical sensing.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Prospects for Developing Pressure and Tactile Sensors Based on Surface Plasmon Resonance
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Prospects for Developing Pressure and Tactile Sensors Based on Surface Plasmon Resonance

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Prop. Óticas e Espectrosc. da Mat. Condens; Outras Inter. da Mat. com Rad. e Part.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Corresponding author: Eduardo Fontana
Abstract:
In this work, one examines the prospects of using the surface plasmon resonance (SPR) effect in the Otto configuration for pressure and deformation sensing. An open Otto chip device was employed, and the chip was characterized by the use of an automated reflectometer operating at a wavelength of λ=975.1 nm. The active area of the device was characterized by reflectometry-based profilometry. Significant modulation of the SPR effect due to a variable gas pressure was observed at a fixed point on the device?s active area. A gap reduction to approximately 50% of its nominal value was observed when the gas pressure changed from 1.7 to 0.28 bar. In addition, profilometry characterization in conjunction with a rigorous regression analysis allowed determining, unambiguously, the gap profile of the device under fixed stress. The results indicate that the technique is feasible for either pressure or tactile sensing applications.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Hybrid Microstrip Device for Hydrogen Detection at Microwave Frequencies
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Hybrid Microstrip Device for Hydrogen Detection at Microwave Frequencies

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
CORRESPONDING AUTHOR: EDUARDO FONTANA
This article describes the analysis, design and construction of a microstrip device capable of detecting hydrogen at microwave frequencies. The proposed structure is a hybrid microstrip line, 10 cm long, having part of the copper line replaced by a strip of palladium film 10 nm thick. A simple formulation has been developed to estimate the device?s insertion loss, as well as the spectral dependence of the S21 parameter. For a device having a 2 cm long Pd section, exposed to 1.6 % hydrogen at a 0.4 bar pressure in nitrogen gas, detection was accomplished by measuring the changes produced on one of the resonances of the scattering parameter S21 in the frequency region around 3.2 GHz. The experimental results, corroborated by the theoretical modeling of the device?s response, indicated that, if on one hand, a Pd thickness much smaller than the skin depth, yields a negligible change in attenuation due to hydrogen absorption, on the other, it favors the phase of the S21 parameter to become a highly sensitive function of the Pd conductivity, in turn facilitating hydrogen detection. This finding opens the possibility of constructing simple hydrogen sensors by incorporating ultrathin Pd films into planar microwave circuits.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Particle swarm optimizer for the surface plasmon resonance effect on metal gratings
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Particle swarm optimizer for the surface plasmon resonance effect on metal gratings

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Prop. Óticas e Espectrosc. da Mat. Condens; Outras Inter. da Mat. com Rad. e Part.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Sensores Ópticos

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Corresponding author: Eduardo Fontana
Abstract:
In this work, the spectral dependence of optimum parameters of the surface plasmon resonance (SPR) effect on metallized sinusoidal diffraction gratings, under normal incidence, were determined using the particle swarm optimization method. The method was chosen due to its simplicity and effectiveness in providing reliable results, relative to direct search or gradient methods. The Rayleigh's hypothesis, which restricts the analysis to the case of shallow gratings, is used to model the diffracted fields across the interface between the sensing medium and metal. A penalty function was applied to avoid the occurrence of singularities and violation of the validity of the Rayleigh hypothesis. Using this procedure, the optimum values of grating periodicity and amplitude that maximized the sensitivity function for gold, silver, copper and aluminum --- metals that yield high quality factor SPR effects --- were determined in a wavelength range between 500 and 1600 nm, both for gaseous and aqueous sensing media.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Microfabricated Otto chip device for surface plasmon resonance-based optical sensing
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Microfabricated Otto chip device for surface plasmon resonance-based optical sensing

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Prop. Óticas e Espectrosc. da Mat. Condens; Outras Inter. da Mat. com Rad. e Part.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
CORRESPONDING AUTHOR: EDUARDO FONTANA
Abstract:
Surface plasmon resonance (SPR) based sensors are usually designed using the Kretschmann prism coupling configuration in which an input beam couples with a surface plasmon through a thin metal film. This is generally preferred by sensor developers for building planar devices instead of the Otto prism coupling configuration, which, for efficient coupling, requires the metal surface to be maintained at a distance on the order of the wavelength from the input prism surface. In this paper, we report on the microfabrication and characterization of an Otto chip device, which is suitable for applications of the SPR effect in gas sensing and biosensing.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
CORRESPONDING AUTHOR: EDUARDO FONTANA
Abstract:

In this paper, we report on the microfabrication and characterization of an Otto chip device, which is suitable for applications of the SPR effect in gas sensing and biosensing.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: D-shaped optical fiber-based refractometer for olive oil adulteration detection
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: D-shaped optical fiber-based refractometer for olive oil adulteration detection

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract
Extra virgin olive oil is a product in great demand, due to its popularity as the healthiest cooking oil. Thanks to its popularity and high price, extra virgin olive oil is also a common target of adulterators who add other vegetable oils in order to increase the volume of the final product. This practice is specially harmful to consumers who choose olive oil due to dietary restrictions, in addition to directly affecting producers, due to unfair competition. Based on this scenario, this work presents a D-shaped optical fiber-based refractive index sensor to detect adulteration of olive oil caused by the addition of canola, corn, cotton, soybean and sunflower oils. The device fabrication and characterization processes are presented, detailing the instrumentation used and the methodology adopted during the measurements. The sensor sensitivity, measured against the added percentage of contaminants, was determined as 0.037 dB/%. The results show that the sensor is capable of detecting adulterations from additions of any combination of the five adulterants greater than 9% of the total volume.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract
Extra virgin olive oil is a product in great demand, due to its popularity as the healthiest cooking oil. Thanks to its popularity and high price, extra virgin olive oil is also a common target of adulterators who add other vegetable oils in order to increase the volume of the final product. This practice is specially harmful to consumers who choose olive oil due to dietary restrictions, in addition to directly affecting producers, due to unfair competition. Based on this scenario, this work presents a D-shaped optical fiber-based refractive index sensor to detect adulteration of olive oil caused by the addition of canola, corn, cotton, soybean and sunflower oils. The device fabrication and characterization processes are presented, detailing the instrumentation used and the methodology adopted during the measurements. The sensor sensitivity, measured against the added percentage of contaminants, was determined as 0.037 dB/%. The results show that the sensor is capable of detecting adulterations from additions of any combination of the five adulterants greater than 9% of the total volume.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Wireless Sensor Node for Chemical Agent Detection
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Wireless Sensor Node for Chemical Agent Detection

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Medidas Elétricas, Magnéticas e Eletrônicas; Instrumentação

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Prop. Óticas e Espectrosc. da Mat. Condens; Outras Inter. da Mat. com Rad. e Part.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this manuscript, we present in detail the design and implementation of the hardware and software to produce a standalone wireless sensor node, called SensorQ system, for the detection of a toxic chemical agent. The proposed wireless sensor node prototype is composed of a micro-controller unit (MCU), a radio frequency (RF) transceiver, a dual-band antenna, a rechargeable battery, a voltage regulator, and four integrated sensing devices, all of them integrated in a package with final dimensions and weight of 200 × 80 × 60 mm and 0.422 kg, respectively. The proposed SensorQ prototype operates using the Long-Range (LoRa) wireless communication protocol at 2.4 GHz, with a sensor head implemented on a hetero-core fiber optic structure supporting the surface plasmon resonance (SPR) phenomenon with a sensing section (L = 10 mm) coated with titanium/gold/titanium and a chemically sensitive material (zinc oxide) for the detection of Di-Methyl Methyl Phosphonate (DMMP) vapor in the air, a simulant of the toxic nerve agent Sarin. The transmitted spectra with respect to different concentrations of DMMP vapor in the air were recorded, and then the transmitted power for these concentrations was calculated at a wavelength of 750 nm. The experimental results indicate the feasibility of detecting DMMP vapor in air using the proposed optical sensor head, with DMMP concentrations in the air of 10, 150, and 150 ppm in this proof of concept. We expect that the sensor and wireless sensor node presented herein are promising candidates for integration into a wireless sensor network (WSN) for chemical warfare agent (CWA) detection and contaminated site monitoring without exposure of armed forces.

The proposed SensorQ prototype operates using the Long-Range (LoRa) wireless communication protocol at 2.4 GHz, with a sensor head implemented on a hetero-core fiber optic structure supporting the surface plasmon resonance (SPR) phenomenon with a sensing section (L = 10 mm) coated with titanium/gold/titanium and a chemically sensitive material (zinc oxide) for the detection of Di-Methyl Methyl Phosphonate (DMMP) vapor in the air, a simulant of the toxic nerve agent Sarin. The transmitted spectra with respect to different concentrations of DMMP vapor in the air were recorded, and then the transmitted power for these concentrations was calculated at a wavelength of 750 nm. The experimental results indicate the feasibility of detecting DMMP vapor in air using the proposed optical sensor head, with DMMP concentrations in the air of 10, 150, and 150 ppm in this proof of concept. We expect that the sensor and wireless sensor node presented herein are promising candidates for integration into a wireless sensor network (WSN) for chemical warfare agent (CWA) detection and contaminated site monitoring without exposure of armed forces.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Novel Sensor System for Leakage Current Detection on Insulator Strings of Overhead Transmission Lines

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Fernando José do Monte de Melo Cavalcanti

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Transmissão da Energia Elétrica, Distribuição da Energia Elétrica

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
índice:
1. Álgebra Vetorial
2. Eletrostática
3. Problemas de Valores de Fronteira em Eletrostática
4. Condução Elétrica
5. Magnetostática

índice:
1 - Lei de Faraday, corrente de deslocamento e equações de Maxwell
2 - Ondas eletromagnéticas
3 - Reflexão e Refração
4 - Linhas de Transmissão
5 - Guias de Onda
6 - Radiação e Antenas

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Dirigido a estudantes em Engenharia Elétrica e áreas afins, o tratado é desenvolvido de forma que a formulação final de Maxwell vai sendo construída a partir da junção das leis experimentais com os conceitos matemáticos embutidos nessas leis, estes derivados das propriedades fundamentais de campos vetoriais. O livro nesta primeira edição tem 760 páginas, conta com cerca de 470 ilustrações, muitas das quais simuladas computacionalmente e em perspectiva 3D e com cerca de 3000 expressões matemáticas. As aplicações das eqs. de Maxwell, incluem propagação eletromagnética, reflexão e refração, linhas de transmissão, guias de onda, radiação e sistemas ressonantes nos regimes transitório e permanente. Simuladores computacionais desenvolvidos pelo autor, e por ele disponibilizados, são empregados para cálculos de linhas de transmissão e de reflectância de estruturas de múltiplas camadas. Alguns tópicos e exemplos inéditos são tratados na obra, incluindo: a) traçado de linhas de campo no espaço 3D e exemplos; b) problemas de valores de fronteira envolvendo funções complexas de base variável e propriedades de ortogonalidade correspondentes; c) relaxação envolvendo múltiplos condutores; d) conceitos de espaço de estados na formulação de energia; e) unificação das propriedades dielétricas e condutoras de meios lineares, no regime dinâmico; f) simulador SmartSmith para cálculos envolvendo linhas de transmissão; g) simulador SWSO para otimização e reflectometria de estruturas de múltiplas camadas; h) formulação vetorial completa da decomposição de modos guiados em ondas planas para guias retangulares; i)análise detalhada de sistemas ressonantes no regime transitório; j)cálculo de ganho de amplitude de campo em cavidades eletromagnéticas, para citar alguns exemplos.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Directed to students in Electrical Engineering and related areas, the treatise is developed in such a way that Maxwell's final formulation is constructed from the experimental laws with the mathematical concepts embedded in these laws, those derived from the fundamental properties of vector fields. The book has about 470 illustrations, many of which are computationally simulated and in 3D perspective. The applications of Maxwell's equations, include electromagnetic propagation, reflection and refraction, transmission lines, waveguides, radiation and resonant systems in the transient and steady regimes. Computer simulators developed by the author, and made available to the public, are used to calculate transmission lines and multilayer reflectance. Some original topics and examples are dealt with in the work, including: a) tracing of field lines in 3D space and examples; b) boundary value problems involving complex functions of variable base and corresponding orthogonality properties; c) relaxation involving multiple conductors; d) concepts of state space in the energy formulation; e) unification of the dielectric and conductive properties of linear media, in the dynamic regime; f) SmartSmith simulator for calculations involving transmission lines; g) SWSO application for optimization and reflectometry of multilayer structures; h) complete vector formulation of the decomposition of guided modes in plane waves for rectangular guides; i) detailed analysis of resonant systems in the transient regime; j) calculation of field amplitude gain in electromagnetic cavities, to name a few.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRA-PRODUCAO.TITULO: An Elegant Form of the Newton-­Raphson Method for the Solution of a set of N Non-­Linear Equations

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Published: February 10, 2013
Abstract: An elegant matrix form is presented for the generalized Newton-Raphson Method for N non-linear equations, to enable simple implementation of the method in numerical computation.

Published on January 20, 2014
Abstract:
A matrix formulation is presented to allow linear and first-order nonlinear regression analysis with multidimensional model functions. Examples of pseudocodes are presented illustrating the implementation of the formulation for numerical computation.

PERMANENT CITATION
"SmartSmith" from the Wolfram Demonstrations Project
 http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/SmartSmith/
Contributed by: Eduardo Fontana

Abstract:
This generalized version of the Smith chart can be an important resource for teachers and students, since it can be applied to a variety of different parameters. This provides a unified approach to the properties of the impedance/admittance function of a transmission line in the complex gamma plane. The chart has sliders for normalized resistance/conductance and reactance/susceptance, magnitude and phase of the reflection coefficient, and relative phase from the load. This enables several operations including single- and double-stub matching. Double-stub matching can be achieved by moving the slider that controls the shifted unit conductance circle.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
PALESTRA CONVIDADA
Resumo:
Neste trabalho são descritos alguns dos sistemas sensores desenvolvidos nos últimos anos no Laboratório de Sensores e Instrumentação do Grupo de Fotônica do Dep. de Eletrônica e Sistemas da UFPE. Sistemas completos para aplicações científicas e industriais têm sido elaborados com base em uma metodologia que abrange desde o projeto da cabeça sensora e do circuito de processamento eletrônico dos sinais ? passando pelo dimensionamento e implantação do sistema de comunicação mais adequado para a transmissão desses sinais ? até o desenvolvimento do aplicativo de aquisição e gerenciamento dos dados para o usuário final. Algumas aplicações são brevemente discutidas, e dois sistemas para aplicações no setor elétrico são descritos de forma mais detalhada.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Invited Paper:
OFS-24 WORKSHOP on Optical Biosensing with Electromagnetic Surface Waves (SPP on Metals and Bloch Modes on Photonic Crystals)
After its identification in the 1980s as a suitable optical transduction mechanism for gas sensing and biosensing [1], the surface plasmon resonance (SPR) effect found widespread commercial use for the latter sensing application in the early 1990s, when real-time, label-free, monitoring systems of biomolecular reactions started to reach the market [2?3]. In this talk, the general properties of surface plasmons at a metal interface are described and the different approaches for observing the SPR effect are discussed, including planar, grating and fiber optic coupling schemes [4], with emphasis on biosensing applications. An analysis is presented on the key parameters that define the sensitivity of the effect for optical sensing. From this analysis, design parameters yielding maximum sensitivity in either planar [5] or grating [6] configurations are presented. Proposals for SPR, grating type, devices for operational normal incidence [7] and Otto chip devices [8] for biosensing with ultralow sample volumes are discussed.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract? This paper describes the development of a single controller of DFB lasers for the simultaneous detection of multiple gases in the near infrared. A preliminary version of the system was implemented by use of a PIC18F4550 microcontroller, an oscillator, D/A converters, solid-state relays, DFB lasers and auxiliary circuitry. A preliminary performance
analysis was carried out to determine the system capability in controlling two DFB lasers as well as to evaluate the system performance in detecting the absorption line of carbon monoxide at the wavelength 1568.036 nm.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: This work proposes three configurations to enhance the sensitivity of retro-reflectance-based optical fiber sensors suitable to detect the interface between immiscible liquids having refractive indices nearly equal to that of the fiber core. Two configurations are based on the use of metallic diffraction gratings, projected to allow excitation of surface plasmons under normal incidence on the sensitive interface. The third configuration is based on the application of a dielectric stack on the sensitive fiber tip. The results indicate that addition of the dielectric stack enhances the reflectance sensitivity to refractive index changes of a bare fiber tip sensor - typically 0.01 - by a factor of approximately 27. Alternatively, the addition of a metallized diffraction grating to a fiber tip sensor yields a device with a sensitivity that can be tailored between 2 and 400, corresponding to enhancement factors between 200 and 40000, respectively.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: A swarm intelligence approach for regression analysis of surface plasmon resonance curves in Otto chips

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IEEE MTT-S International Microwave and Optoelectronics Conference
DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.INSTITUICAO-PROMOTORA: Sociedade Brasileira de Microondas e Optoeletrônica
DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.LOCAL-DA-APRESENTACAO: Centro Cultural e de Congressos de Aveiro

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: The use of the Otto configuration, as an alternative to Kretschmann's, in the construction of Surface Plasmon Resonance (SPR) sensors is an underdeveloped research area. Recently, a version of an Otto based device, baptized as Otto chip, was manufactured. Regression analysis procedures can be used to help the chip characterization by adjusting parameters of the model reflectance curve. However, as in any classical regression procedure, the initial guess must be close enough to the final solution to avoid convergence to a local minimum. An alternative approach to the classical regression procedure is the use of computational techniques inspired on swarms. Swarm intelligence, as this area of computer science is known, has successfully been used by engineers in various optimization problems. One prominent algorithm is the Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) that stands out for its low computational cost, simplicity of implementation and high efficiency on finding global optimum solutions. This paper describes the use of PSO in regression analysis of experimental SPR curves. It was shown that the PSO technique yields better results when compared with classical regression analysis methods.

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Seminários do Programa de Pós-Graduação em Engenharia de Sistemas da UPE

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo: Nesta palestra, em luz da cada vez mais crescente de sistemas sensores em nosso cotidiano analisa-se como é estruturada a linha de pesquisa em Sistemas Sensores de forma geral, com ênfase na multiplicidade de conhecimentos envolvidos nos vários segmentos que compõem a estrutura da área. A discussão é então dirigida para alguns sistemas sensores em desenvolvimento no Grupo de Fotônica do Dep. de Eletrônica e Sistemas da UFPE, o que inclui, aplicações do fenômeno de Ressonância de Plásmons de Superfície no desenvolvimento de sensores, sensores em frequências de micro-ondas, entre outros. A palestra inclui também soluções que foram implantadas em campo, incluindo o sistema de monitoração por satélite, desenvolvido no Grupo de Fotônica - DES - UFPE, com objetivo de aferir o grau de poluição em isoladores de alta tensão, com uma rede de sensores distribuída em diversas torres de alta tensão do sistema Chesf no Nordeste do Brasil.
Duração aproximada: 01h18m

Tratado de Eletromagnetismo: estratégias de ensino nas engenharias
Palestra de Eduardo Fontana
Evento: Momento Magnético
Promoção: Sociedade Brasileira de Eletromagnetismo
Data: 17/11/2021
Crazy Blues by Edu Fontana - https://soundcloud.com/eduardo-fontan...
Resumo: Nesta palestra é feito um levantamento do histórico das atividades e ações de ensino na área de Eletromagnetismo na Engenharia Eletrônica da UFPE, nos últimos 40 anos, por parte do palestrante, culminando com a produção da obra de sua autoria, "Tratado de Eletromagnetismo", com prognóstico de publicação em Fevereiro de 2022 pela Editora da Unicamp.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Ressonância de Plásmons de Superfície em Grade de Difração de Alumínio Sob Incidência Normal

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Simpósio Brasileiro de Micro-ondas e Optoeletrônica - SBMO 2022
DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.INSTITUICAO-PROMOTORA: Sociedade Brasileira de Micro-ondas e Optoeletrônica

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Prop. Óticas e Espectrosc. da Mat. Condens; Outras Inter. da Mat. com Rad. e Part.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Como parte de um projeto de fabricação de sensores otimizados baseados na excitação de ressonância de plásmons de superfície (RPS) sob incidência normal, este trabalho apresenta resultados computacionais e experimentais obtidos em grade de difração metalizada com alumínio. Nos resultados experimentais, é possível identificar claramente o efeito de RPS e sua eliminação, quando a polarizaçµao do feixe de luz incidente é desviada em relação àquela prevista para ocorrência do efeito. Esses resultados corroboram com a viabilidade da proposta de observação de RPS sob incidência normal e a eficácia do modelo de simulação proposto..

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: After its identification in the 1980s as a suitable optical transduction mechanism for gas sensing and biosensing, the surface plasmon resonance (SPR) effect found widespread commercial use for the latter sensing application in the early 1990s, when real-time, label-free, monitoring systems of biomolecular reactions started to reach the market. However, biosensing is not the only application of the SPR effect, as it can be applied for measuring a number of physical parameters, including, refractive index of both absorbing and non-absorbing materials, temperature, pressure, surface roughness and profile, as well as for gas detection and for development of optical devices and components. In this 4-hour short course, the general properties of surface plasmons at a metal interface are described. Techniques for coupling photons with surface plasmons are then discussed and the different approaches for observing the SPR effect are analyzed, including planar, grating and fiber optic coupling schemes. An analysis is presented on the key parameters that define the sensitivity of the effect for optical sensing. From this analysis, design parameters yielding maximum sensitivity are presented. Proposals for SPR, for planar and grating type, devices are discussed with either optical fibers or discrete optical elements. As part of the short course, the students will have the opportunity to employ online simulators (SWSO, SPRinG), developed by the author, to project SPR devices tailored for operation on either wavelength or wavevector interrogation mode.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: After its identification in the 1980s as a suitable optical transduction mechanism for gas sensing and biosensing, the surface plasmon resonance (SPR) effect found widespread commercial use for the latter sensing application in the early 1990s, when real-time, label-free, monitoring systems of biomolecular reactions started to reach the market. However, biosensing is not the only application of the SPR effect, as it can be applied for measuring a number of physical parameters, including, refractive index of both absorbing and non-absorbing materials, temperature, pressure, surface roughness and profile, as well as for gas detection and for development of optical devices and components. In this 4-hour short course, the general properties of surface plasmons at a metal interface are described. Techniques for coupling photons with surface plasmons are then discussed and the different approaches for observing the SPR effect are analyzed, including planar, grating and fiber optic coupling schemes. An analysis is presented on the key parameters that define the sensitivity of the effect for optical sensing. From this analysis, design parameters yielding maximum sensitivity are presented. Proposals for SPR, for planar and grating type, devices are discussed with either optical fibers or discrete optical elements. As part of the short course, the students will have the opportunity to employ online simulators (SWSO, SPRinG), developed by the author, to project SPR devices tailored for operation on either wavelength or wavevector interrogation mode.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Magnons in Magnetic Semiconductors
Author: Eduardo Fontana

Abstract: In this talk the author reviews his first encounter as an undergraduate student with the renowned brazilian scientist Sérgio Rezende in the late 70s, and the scope of his follow up work under the supervision of Rezende, on the investigation of the low temperature properties of magnetic semiconductors. The author presents some of the landmarks of his Master thesis work during that period of time and some of the peculiar aspects of his interaction with Rezende.

Event: Workshop on Magnetism and magnetic materials: from basic Physics to Magnonics ? In celebration to the 80th anniversary of Prof. Sérgio Machado Rezende
Organization: UFPE?Physics Department, Recife, Brazil

Date: October 16, 2020
Duration: 22:23

Workshop organizing committee: 
Cid Bartolomeu de Araújo ? chair
Antonio Azevedo da Costa
Eduardo Padrón Hernández
Fernando Luis de Araújo Machado
Flávio Menezes de Aguiar

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Fibras Ópticas e Dispositivos a Fibra

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-MATERIAL-DIDATICO-OU-IN.TITULO: Vídeo sobre Dispersão e Interferência intersimbólica

DETALHAMENTO-DO-MATERIAL-DIDATICO-OU-INS.FINALIDADE: Animações matemáticas para elucidação de fenômenos físicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Esta simulação ilustra a distribuição espacial da amplitude de dois pacotes de onda gaussianos, modulados por uma portadora de alta frequência e se propagando em um meio de dispersão quadrática. Os efeitos observados são:
1. Alargamento de cada pulso e redução de amplitude, sem perda de energia
2. Interferência intersimbólica. 
Devido à dispersão, os pacotes começam a ocupar uma mesma região do espaço e o efeito resultante é a produção de vários batimentos no espaço, o que resulta em vários mini-pacotes de onda.
Duração: 00:10

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-MATERIAL-DIDATICO-OU-IN.TITULO: Vídeo: Velocidade de fase e velocidade de grupo

DETALHAMENTO-DO-MATERIAL-DIDATICO-OU-INS.FINALIDADE: Animações matemáticas para elucidação de fenômenos físicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Esta animação ilustra a diferença fundamental entre velocidade de fase e velocidade de grupo. Os pacotes de onda se propagam com a velocidade de grupo e a portadora de alta frequência se propaga com a velocidade de fase.
Duração: 00:05

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-MATERIAL-DIDATICO-OU-IN.TITULO: Eletromagnetismo - Oscilação de campo magnético na vizinhança de condutor

DETALHAMENTO-DO-MATERIAL-DIDATICO-OU-INS.FINALIDADE: Animações matemáticas para elucidação de fenômenos físicos

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Esta simulação ilustra a forma de onda do campo magnético de uma onda incidente em um condutor. Forma-se uma onda estacionária no exterior e uma onda lenta que penetra no interior do condutor, com decaimento exponencial.
O vídeo é parte integrante do e-book "Eletromagnetismo - Parte 2"
http://www.ufpe.br/fontana/Eletromagnetismo2
Autor: Eduardo Fontana
Professor Titular
Dep. de Eletrônica e Sistemas
Universidade Federal de Pernambuco
Calculado com Mathematica 7
Copyright by Eduardo Fontana
Produção: Vidgital
Maio 2011
Duração: 21 segundos

DETALHAMENTO-DO-MATERIAL-DIDATICO-OU-INS.FINALIDADE: Animações matemáticas para elucidação de fenômenos físicos

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Esta simulação ilustra o efeito pelicular de um campo eletromagnético em um condutor, como função da condutividade.
O vídeo é parte integrante do e-book "Eletromagnetismo - Parte 2"
http://www.ufpe.br/fontana/Eletromagnetismo2
Autor: Eduardo Fontana
Professor Titular
Dep. de Eletrônica e Sistemas
Universidade Federal de Pernambuco
Calculado com Mathematica 7
Copyright by Eduardo Fontana
Produção: Vidgital
Maio 2011
Duração: 28 segundos

DETALHAMENTO-DO-MATERIAL-DIDATICO-OU-INS.FINALIDADE: Animações matemáticas para elucidação de fenômenos físicos

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This simulation illustrates the modifications produced in the 3D intensity radiation pattern of a dipole antenna, as the half-length is varied relative to the wavelength. The plots are normalized to the total radiated power and the antenna is aligned vertically.
Created in Mathematica 8
Published on 06/24/2011
Author: Eduardo Fontana
Vidgital 2011

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Spatial noise interference due to two optical silica windows of thickness d = 4 mm each
as a function of the incidence angle. The Brewster angle occurs at Θ = 55.293 degrees. The absorption of CO is that experimentally obtained from a cell of 130 cm length at a concentration of 35,000 ppm. The line's central wavelength is λ = 1568.774 nm. 
A laser beam polarized in the incidence plane is assumed.
Calculated with Mathcad 15 by Eduardo Fontana on 27/09/2012.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-MATERIAL-DIDATICO-OU-IN.TITULO: Variação de potencial na calha cilíndrica

DETALHAMENTO-DO-MATERIAL-DIDATICO-OU-INS.FINALIDADE: Material audiovisual instrucional e de divulgação científica

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Atividades cinematográficas, produção de vídeos e de programas de televisão; gravação de som e edição de música

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Distribuição de potencial em região bi-dimensional com potenciais de sinais opostos na fronteira. A diferença de potencial na fronteira varia continuamente no tempo.
Fonte: http://www.ufpe.br/fontana/ee982/aulas/aula09.html.
Publicado em 04/06/2012

DETALHAMENTO-DO-MATERIAL-DIDATICO-OU-INS.FINALIDADE: Material audiovisual instrucional e de divulgação científica

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Atividades cinematográficas, produção de vídeos e de programas de televisão; gravação de som e edição de música

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
O vídeo ilustra a geração da função δ de Dirac a partir da relação de completeza de funções ortogonais do tipo seno ou cosseno. À medida que mais funções são adicionadas à soma que define a relação de completeza, mais próxima a função soma se torna da função δ de Dirac.
Fonte http:/www.ufpe.br/fontana/ee982/aulas/aula07.html
Publicado em 04/06/2012

DETALHAMENTO-DO-MATERIAL-DIDATICO-OU-INS.FINALIDADE: Material audiovisual instrucional e de divulgação científica

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Atividades cinematográficas, produção de vídeos e de programas de televisão; gravação de som e edição de música

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
O vídeo ilustra o comportamento de funções de Bessel de ordem zero, ortogonais no intervalo -1≤x≤1. Um código mathcad foi desenvolvido para calcular as raízes de J0. O código retorna um vetor k cuja m-ésima componente é a raíz km. As funções aí representadas são da forma J0(km.x).
Fonte http:/www.ufpe.br/fontana/ee903
Autor: Eduardo Fontana
Data: 26062012
Produção: Vidgital

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
For a clear view of the details of this example, set the playback to the highest quality (HD) and watch the video in full screen. (Language: english, legends: portuguese)
In this example the web app "Prisma" is used as a virtual prism positioner to determine what are the positioning parameters for an equilateral BK7 prism, for a preset internal incidence angle and image point on one face.
Author: Eduardo Fontana
Date: July 10, 2013
http://www.ufpe.br/fontana/Prisma
Video edition and production by Eduardo Fontana (Vidgital Studios) - 2013

Procedure conceived to fabricate microstructures of gold to support support surface plasmons in the Otto configuration. Produced by Eduardo Fontana
August 2013

DETALHAMENTO-DO-MATERIAL-DIDATICO-OU-INS.FINALIDADE: Desenvolvimento de material didático ou instrucional - Conteúdo Digital e Material audiovisual instrucional e de divulgação científica

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-1: Spr, Ressonancia de Plasmon de Superficie

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Prop. Óticas e Espectrosc. da Mat. Condens; Outras Inter. da Mat. com Rad. e Part.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricação de equipamentos de informática, produtos eletrônicos e ópticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Lecture presentation @ IEEE Sensors 2016, Orlando - FL - October 31, 2016
by Leonardo Machado Cavalcanti
Paper authors: Leonardo Machado Cavalcanti and Eduardo Fontana
Dep. de Eletrônica e Sistemas
Universidade Federal de Pernambuco
Recife, PE ? Brasil
Abstract:
One of the main challenges of designing Surface
Plasmon Resonance ? SPR ? sensors is to maximize their
sensitivity. In this paper two heuristic algorithms are investigated
? Monte Carlo and Particle Swarm ? for optimization of the
sensitivity of SPR sensors in both the Kretschmann and the Otto
configurations without the aid of a lorentzian approximation.
Due to the random nature of the heuristic algorithms, a simple
and robust approach has been obtained for achieving this
optimization. A comparison is made in terms of computational
efficiency between the proposed algorithms and the traditional
optimization method, which demonstrates that the Particle
Swarm algorithm is the most efficient among them. By applying
this method, the spectral dependence of optimum parameters is
obtained for sensors in Kretschmann and Otto configurations,
for applications in both gaseous and aqueous media, using Au as
the metal. Furthermore, a web app has been developed for
designing optimized SPR sensors using the methods presented
here.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This video illustrates the best fit SPR (surface plasmon resonance) curves for both solutions of the open Otto chip measured at the Instrumentation and Measurement Laboratory (ISL) ? Photonics Group ? Electronics and Systems Department ? Federal University of Pernambuco. 
Measured at LSI's automated reflectometer
λ= 975.1 nm
Otto chip multilayer structure ? Silicon - Au - Air Gap - BK7 Prism
The information is used to retrieve the gap profile of the chip.
Wolfram Mathematica code by: Eduardo Fontana
Mathcad code by: Eduardo Fontana
Adobe Premiere Pro sequence edited and produced by: Eduardo Fontana
Otto chip fabrication and characterization by: Jung-Mu Kim (Chonbuk National University, Korea), Ignacio Llamas-Garro (CTTC, Spain), Gustavo Oliveira Cavalcanti (UPE, Brazil), José Otávio Maciel Neto (IFPE, UFPE, Brazil) Gabriel de Freitas Fernandes (UFPE, Brazil) and Eduardo Fontana (UFPE, Brazil)
Published May 15, 2015

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Title: TE and TM mode patterns in a metallic circular waveguide
Abstract: 
These patterns are the density plot representations of the active power density of modes in a metallic circular waveguide. There are important differences between the TE and TM patterns. One can identify the lowest order mode ?? the TE11 mode ?? as it exhibits the smallest degree of variation across the waveguide cross section, in turn the smallest cutoff wavenumber. An arbitrary rotation of the pattern around the longitudinal axis corresponds to the same mode index

Author: Eduardo Fontana
Departamento de Eletrônica e Sistemas
Universidade Federal de Pernambuco

Patterns were calculated with Wolfram Mathematica 11
"Circular Modes" ? played in the background is a song composed by E. Fontana
Vidgital
May 2018

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Effect of a Pair of Silica Etalon Windows on CO Absorption in the Near Infrared
Author: Eduardo Fontana
Dep. de Eletrônica e Sistemas
Universidade Federal de Pernambuco

Calculated and Simulated with Wolfram Mathematica

Abstract: Interference due to two silica windows, each of thickness d = 4 mm on the transmittance of a 130 cm column of carbon monoxide, as a function of the incidence angle, relative to the window normal direction. The target line is the 1568.035 located in the near infrared overtone band of carbon monoxide The Brewster angle for silica in the spectral region analyzed occurs at Θ = 55.293 degrees. The absorption lineshape and strength of CO is that expected for a 3.5% concentration at 1 atm pressure and at room temperature. A DFB laser beam polarized in the incidence plane is assumed. The simulation demonstrates that, unless the cell is fabricated with the windows aligned very close to the Brewster angle, the interference effect can dominate the transmittance function. As the incidence angle approaches the Brewster angle, the absorption line becomes clearly identified.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Effect of a Pair of Silica Etalon Windows on CO Absorption in the Near Infrared
Author: Eduardo Fontana
Dep. de Eletrônica e Sistemas
Universidade Federal de Pernambuco

Calculated and Simulated with Wolfram Mathematica

Abstract: Interference due to two silica windows, each of thickness d = 4 mm on the transmittance of a 130 cm column of carbon monoxide, as a function of the incidence angle, relative to the window normal direction. The target line is the 1568.035 located in the near infrared overtone band of carbon monoxide The Brewster angle for silica in the spectral region analyzed occurs at Θ = 55.293 degrees. The absorption lineshape and strength of CO is that expected for a 3.5% concentration at 1 atm pressure and at room temperature. A DFB laser beam polarized in the incidence plane is assumed. The simulation demonstrates that, unless the cell is fabricated with the windows aligned very close to the Brewster angle, the interference effect can dominate the transmittance function. As the incidence angle approaches the Brewster angle, the absorption line becomes clearly identified.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
VideoPaper Title: Diffusion of Dissolved Acetylene Molecules through a Transformer Oil Column Measured by Wavelength Modulation Spectroscopy
Authors: Vladimir Homobono* Soares and Eduardo Fontana**


* Escola Politécnica, Universidade de Pernambuco, Recife ? PE, Brazil
** Dep. de Eletrônica e Sistemas, Universidade Federal de Pernambuco, Recife ? PE, Brazil

Published on April 17, 2020
Background song ? "Dreaming Awake" by Eduardo Fontana
Video creation and edition by Eduardo Fontana
 Abstract:

In this video, one demonstrates the use of Wavelength Modulation Spectroscopy for the real-time measurement of the diffusion of dissolved molecules in mineral oil, of the type traditionally used as electrical insulators and coolers of high-voltage transformers. The video illustrates the proposed set-up for measurement in which the oil sample is at rest in a 50 cm long metal tube, interconnected with a gas chamber, through which a laser beam is transmitted. The laser beam probes the build-up of gas concentration in the gas cell. The video also shows the time evolution of the measured wave-shape of the 2nd. harmonic signal, associated with the optical absorption for the case of acetylene molecules. One also presents the predicted spatial dependence of concentration in the oil column, if the observation time could be extended for a period of 18 months, for the value measured for the diffusion coefficient of acetylene within the oil. The measured diffusion coefficient at 21 C was approximately D = 0.08 sq. cm/hour. This gives a diffusion time of approximately 3 1/2 years for the 50 cm oil column.


Acknowledgments and Financial Support:
Chesf ? Companhia Hidro Elétrica do São Francisco
CNPq - Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico
FACEPE ? Fundação de Amparo .à Ciência, Tecnologia e Inovação do Estado de Pernambuco.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-MATERIAL-DIDATICO-OU-IN.TITULO-INGLES: Advanced Electromagnetics - PGEE936

DETALHAMENTO-DO-MATERIAL-DIDATICO-OU-INS.FINALIDADE: Conteúdo Digital e Material audiovisual instrucional e de divulgação científica

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagação de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This is a 60h course on Electromagnetism for graduate students either seeking the Master's or PhD degree in Electrical Engineering. The course is part of the Photonics curriculum of UFPE's Graduate Program in Electrical Engineering (PPGEE). Relative to a traditional undergraduate course on the subject, PGEE936 employs a more in-depth mathematical formulation to solve electromagnetic problems. The mathematical tools include the use of Dirac's delta function for localized sources, solution of Poisson's and 2nd order non-homogeneous differential equations by use of Green's functions in 3D space, use of special functions and concepts of orthogonally for solving boundary value problems either in electrostatics, magnetostatics or in conducting media, as well as extensive use of vector algebra. The course covers mostly static fields, and use of the advanced mathematical tools for determining those fields. The final part of the course is dedicated to assembling Maxwell's equations for dynamic fields and exploring the homogeneous and non-homogeneous forms of the wave equation. Plane waves, attenuation and dispersion are treated in the final part of the course. The topics that compose PGEE936 form the basis for more advanced applications of the Eletromagnetic Theory. The follow-up course offered by PPGEE-UFPE on this theme is PGEE937 ? Fundamentals of Optics and Wave Propagation. PGEE936 and PGEE937 together form the foundations of Electromagnetics of static and dynamic fields at the graduate level, in the Photonics curriculum offered by PPGEE-UFPE.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This is a 60h course on Electromagnetism for graduate students either seeking the Master's or PhD degree in Electrical Engineering. Relative to a traditional undergraduate course on the subject, PGEE936 employs a more in-depth mathematical formulation to solve electromagnetic problems. The mathematical tools include the use of Dirac's delta function for localized sources, solution of Poisson's and 2nd order non-homogeneous differential equations by use of Green's functions in 3D space, use of special functions and concepts of orthogonally for solving boundary value problems either in electrostatics, magnetostatics or in conducting media, as well as extensive use of vector algebra. The course covers mostly static fields, and use of the advanced mathematical tools for determining those fields. The final part of the course is dedicated to assembling Maxwell's equations for dynamic fields and exploring the homogeneous and non-homogeneous forms of the wave equation. Plane waves, attenuation and dispersion are treated in the final part of the course. The topics that compose PGEE936 form the basis for more advanced applications of the Eletromagnetic Theory. The follow-up course offered by PPGEE-UFPE on this theme is PGEE937 ? Fundamentals of Optics and Wave Propagation. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Recent work directed to development of hydrogen sensors using microwave frequencies. Research involves the collaboration of scientists from the Photonics Group, Department of Electronics and Systems - UFPE, Polytechnic school of Pernambuco - UPE, Physiscs Department - UFPE and CTTC, Castelldefels, Spain.
Authors: Keila Santos (PPGEE-UFPE), Gustavo Oliveira Cavalcanti (Poli-UPE), Antonio Azevedo (Física-UFPE), Marcos Melo (DES-UFPE), Ignacio Llamas-Garro(CTTC, Castelldefelfs, Spain) and Eduardo Fontana (DES-UFPE)
A 2023 Vidgital Studios Production.
Crazy Blues - by Edu Fontana (https://soundcloud.com/eduardo-fontan...)
February 11, 2023
